data.text: Debt instruments that automatically shield countries during a crisis, in exchange for higher payouts during good times, could help them navigate global turbulence and also benefit creditors. Read new IMF staff paper. https://t.co/qWxJIeF5Wb #IMFBlog https://t.co/Sexhti3KEO
The COVID-19 pandemic has only added to the massive development needs of fragile states like South Sudan. https://t.co/VfMCTHK6zX #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/UE3cM4uGY3

Countries in the Middle East, North Africa, the Caucasus & Central Asia responded to the COVID-19 pandemic with swift & stringent measures to mitigate its spread and impact but continue to face an uncertain and difficult environment. #SouthSudan is working toward a better economic future after years of war and recent floods. Emergency assistance from the IMF is helping the country deal with the most acute challenges of the #COVID19 crisis. #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/VfMCTI1HYx https://t.co/8x1iwFIRJc

The IMF has disbursed over $30 billion to more than one-third of our member-countries. This 90-second milestone video, reveals how we are meeting the #COVID19 challenge, and how much we have to give. https://t.co/MsAoitSXT6 https://t.co/kZnVrcOisL

IMF staff and the government of #Argentina started working on an IMF program to support their plans to address the country’s economic and social challenges. Good progress has been made so far and talks are set to continue over the coming weeks. https://t.co/48wWe6dMC3 https://t.co/SFLYrSDdiO

#SovereignDebt restructurings present an important opportunity to include disaster relief clauses, which can provide valuable insurance from default to vulnerable countries. More in this new staff research: https://t.co/I8hfBPiYTc https://t.co/ZIRITsUgq4

Is high public debt cause for alarm? As governments around the world are taking on debt at levels surpassing those during World War II, some governments will be in a better position to sustain their debt than others. https://t.co/4z8lrvghjL https://t.co/0CLgJ5qMgA
The IMF’s rapid response to the needs triggered by COVID-19 has been unprecedented. More in our #ChartOfTheWeek: https://t.co/LPGrR7sfmg #IMFBlog https://t.co/4TvkRK5zPF

The new #G20 Common Framework goes even further: it will allow poorer countries to apply for permanent debt relief and ensure that all creditors negotiate on a level playing field. https://t.co/RHaGXcf4vF https://t.co/AdRW8M0v63
#G20 Debt Service Suspension Initiative has given many low-income countries temporary ‘breathing space’ in their fight against the virus. https://t.co/RHaGXcf4vF

Innovations in how countries issue bonds, borrowing ideas from the corporate sector, could help make their debt more resilient to crises & facilitate restructurings when needed; new IMF staff research looks into state-contingent debt instruments. #IMFBlog https://t.co/qWxJIeF5Wb https://t.co/R4P7xz3vVX
Crises spark innovation. Statisticians rapidly developed new measures and methods to provide relevant data quickly during #COVID-19. https://t.co/bFMYdbimDp #StatsForum https://t.co/jJabS2kkzy

Environmental sustainability is essential for a more resilient and inclusive economy. The right mix of green investment and carbon pricing could create about 12 million new jobs over a decade and put us on a path to net zero emissions by 2050. #IMFBlog  https://t.co/AyBx5nv8kp https://t.co/kpfNYEVPsJ

IMF staff and #Egypt’s authorities have reached agreement on the first review of the economic plan supported by IMF Stand-By Arrangement.
